content.description:
Source: Transparency International, 2016.

NOTE: 0 = total corruption and 100 = no corruption.
content.question: Which of the following is an implication of the data for Nigeria?

choices.label: Corruption will continue to get worse because most politicians refuse to see it as a major issue.
Corruption is no longer an issue because the Nigerian military has arrested public officials accused of taking bribes.
The government has curtailed corruption in many areas, but it still continues to be a major issue for policy makers.
Citizen protests led to the eradication of governmental corruption in Nigeria.

content.answer: The government has curtailed corruption in many areas, but it still continues to be a major issue for policy makers.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
